resizablePanel.description: You can move the window around the screen and change its size by dragging the bottom right corner.

documentation.content:
Auction Service for Streamers - pointauc.com

Overview

This service is designed to enhance the interaction between streamers and their audiences by providing a fun and engaging way to make decisions during live streams. Whether it's deciding which game a streamer should play next, which video or movie they should watch with their audience, or running a lottery or contest, this service offers a versatile set of tools to make your streams more interactive and entertaining.

The service features seamless integration with Twitch Channel Points and Donation Alerts, allowing streamers to easily manage incoming donations and channel point redemptions. This saves valuable time and energy, enabling streamers to focus on what they do best—entertaining their audience!

Integrations

The Pointauc supports the following integrations to enhance your streaming experience:

  • Twitch Channel Points:

    Allows viewers to use their channel points to participate in auctions, lotteries, and other activities directly through Twitch.

  • Donation Alerts:

    Integrates with Donation Alerts to manage monetary donations, which can be used in place of or alongside channel points in auctions and contests.

  • DonatePay (another donation service)

Features

1. Game & Content Auctions

  • Streamers can create auctions where viewers bid using channel points or donations to decide which game should be played next or which content should be watched during the stream or any other activity.

2. Lotteries & Contests

  • Run exciting lotteries or contests where viewers can participate using their channel points or donations. Multiple formats are available, including random draw, highest bid, or entry-based selection.

3. Decision-Making Tools

  • Choose from a variety of interactive decision-making tools to select winners or make choices:
    • Wheel of Fortune: Spin a wheel to randomly select a winner or outcome.
    • Dropout Wheel: Eliminate options gradually until only one remains.
    • Battle Royale: A competitive elimination-style game where participants are gradually removed until the final winner is determined.

4. Real-Time Updates

  • Real-time tracking and updates ensure that viewers and streamers are always in sync with the latest bids.

5. Customizable Settings

  • Streamers can personalize the website's appearance, automate timer rules, and add custom enhancements like Marbles on Stream Auction and more. Additionally, the service supports automatic bid creation using channel points, simplifying a work for the streamer.

Suggestions and bug reports

You can create an issue if you want to suggest something or tell about a bug.

bidsManagement.allActions: These actions will be applied to channel points redemptions:

requestStatus.error: Error: bids were not processed or partially processed, please check manually.

modalTitle.returnAllExceptWinner: Return everything except for the winner
modalTitle.returnAllExceptFirst: Return everything except for the first place

bidsManagement.disclaimer: This is a new feature, so it is recommended to double-check everything manually. If you encounter any errors, you can submit them via the form and I will fix them.
bidsManagement.tooManyBids: More then 9999 bids cannot be processed at the moment

/.title: Pointauc | Live Auction for Streamers
/.description: Host interactive auctions where your viewers can bid on games, videos, and more using Twitch channel points or donations.

/settings.title: Settings & Integrations | Customize Your Experience
/settings.description: Configure your auction settings and integrations with Twitch, Donation Alerts, and DonatePay. Personalize your auction with automated timers, custom appearance, alternative auction types and more.

/wheel.title: Wheel of Random | Spin to Decide Auction Winners
/wheel.description: Use the Wheel of Random to decide auction winners with a fun and engaging spin. Choose from various types of wheels to add excitement and suspense to your live stream auctions.

/statistic.title: Statistics | Track Viewer Participation & Bidding Activity
/statistic.description: Monitor real-time statistics for your current auction, including viewer participation and bids.

/history.title: Auction History & Channel Points Management | Review Past Bids
/history.description: Access a complete history of all previous bids. Easily manage channel points redemptions.

/help.title: About the website Pointauc
/help.description: Discover how the Pointauc transforms your live streams by enabling interactive auctions, lotteries, and contests. Learn about our features, integrations, and customization options.

regionSelect.title: Select Region
regionSelect.description: Choose the region based on the DonatePay domain you use for your account.

tokenModal.title: DonatePay Integration
tokenModal.description: Connecting DonatePay allows you to display incoming donations directly on the site in real-time. This significantly simplifies and speeds up the process of adding bids to the auction and unlocks several new site features.
tokenModal.privacy: The site does NOT track or store donation statistics on its servers, including personal streamer information such as email, card data, balance, etc. All statistics found on the site are stored in the browser on the user's computer and are deleted when the tab is closed.
tokenModal.warning: DO NOT SHOW THE API KEY OR THE DONATEPAY PAGE ON STREAM!
tokenModal.instructions: Go to the page <1>{{url}}</1>, then copy the value of the "Your API Key" field and paste it into the field below.
tokenModal.confirmHideScreen: Before navigating to the next page, hide your screen on the stream

serverNotifications.deployIncoming: Server update will start {{remainingEstimation}} ({{remainingTime}}). After that donations and rewards will stop coming for 1-5 min.

auc.chanceTooltip: Text is rounded to 2 decimal places, but the chance of winning is still calculated based on the actual value.

casino.description: You need to spin the normal wheel; if your selected lot wins, the bid will multiply by a specified number, otherwise, it will be reset.
casino.warning: This function does not provide gain or loss for the donor!

auc.clearAllConfirmationDetails: This action will clear all lots and bids.
auc.optimizationEnabled: Lot animations are disabled to improve performance (lots > 100)
auc.revertClearAll: Click here to cancel the clearing of all lots ({{count}})

overlays.title: Overlays

securityWarning.title: ⚠️ Important Security Warning
securityWarning.description: You absolutely should NOT show or share the overlay link with anyone!
securityWarning.issues: Sharing the overlay link may lead to:
securityWarning.issue1: Other people will be able to see spin outcome before the wheel spin is finished
securityWarning.issue2: People will be able to track auction lots and rules changes anytime
securityWarning.issue3: However, other people WON'T have WRITE access to your settings (only READ)

overlays.createSuccessMessage: Overlay "{{name}}" has been created and you've been redirected to the edit page

betaWarning.title: Beta Feature
betaWarning.description: This feature is brand new and actively being developed. You may encounter bugs or unexpected behavior. We recommend checking back regularly for updates and improvements.
betaWarning.reportIssue: If you find any issues, please

statusMessages.error: Error loading overlay. Please check your connection and try again.
statusMessages.waitingForWheelData: Overlay is waiting for data... Please open the Wheel page on the main website to initialize the overlay.
statusMessages.waitingForAuctionData: Overlay is waiting for data... Please open the Auction page on the main website to initialize the overlay.

wheel.description: Spinning wheel overlay for randomly selecting winners.

settings.title: Settings
settings.backgroundTransparencyDescription: Adjust the background transparency (0 = opaque, 100 = transparent)
settings.backgroundTransparencyDescriptionWheel: Adjust the background transparency (0 = transparent, 100 = opaque)

canvasResolution.label: Canvas Resolution
canvasResolution.tooltip: This is your <1>Base (Canvas) Resolution</1> in OBS. For better accuracy use the exact same values for the <1>width</1> and <1>height</1> of your browser source.

preview.title: Preview
preview.description: This section will show a live preview of how your {{type}} overlay will appear on your stream with the current settings.

welcome.title: Welcome to Overlays!
welcome.description: This feature allows you to add transparent auction UI inside your broadcasting software for better control over the look and feeling of your stream.
welcome.benefit1: • Real-time updates: lots and wheel spins automatically synchronize with what happens on the website.
welcome.benefit2: • More control: you can hide unnecessary sections and arrange elements however you like.

instructions.title: Overlays Setup Guide
instructions.helpButtonHint: You can reopen these instructions anytime by clicking the help button (?) near the page title at the top of the screen.
instructions.listPageDescription: On the main overlays page, you'll see all your created overlays. Click the "New Overlay" button to create a new one.
instructions.createOverlayDescription: Select the type of overlay you want to create: Auction (shows your auction bids and timer) or Wheel (displays the spinning wheel). Each overlay is created with sensible defaults that you can customize later.
instructions.editPageDescription: After creating an overlay, you'll be taken to the editor page with two main sections:
instructions.settingsPanelDescription: Configure overlay-specific options like which elements to display, background transparency, canvas resolution, and more.
instructions.previewPanelDescription: Adjust the overlay position and size by dragging and resizing. Changes are saved automatically and will be reflected in OBS.
instructions.detailsContent1: After saving changes, your active overlay will be updated automatically.
instructions.detailsContent2: Canvas Resolution should match your streaming resolution (typically 1920x1080 for 1080p or 1280x720 for 720p).
instructions.detailsContent3: You can create multiple overlays with different settings for different scenes in your streaming software.
instructions.obsWarning: Stretch the overlay to the entire screen and do not move it. All positioning is controlled through the preview panel on the website.
instructions.obsStep1Description: On the overlay edit page, find the "OBS Link" section and click "Copy Link" to copy your unique overlay URL.
instructions.obsStep2Title: Step 2: Add Browser Source in OBS
instructions.obsStep2Description: In OBS, right-click in your Sources panel, select "Add" → "Browser", and paste the overlay URL.
instructions.obsSettingsDescription: Use these settings when adding the Browser source:
instructions.refreshWhenActive: Refresh browser when scene becomes active
instructions.advancedTip1: Match the Width and Height in OBS to your Canvas Resolution setting on the website for pixel-perfect alignment.
instructions.advancedTip2: If the overlay doesn't appear immediately, make sure you have the auction or wheel page open on the website to initialize the data.
instructions.finalStepDescription: Your overlay is now set up! Any changes you make on the website (bids, settings, positioning) will automatically update in OBS.

rewardPresetsConfirmation.title: Warning
rewardPresetsConfirmation.description: After updating rewards, current viewer redemptions cannot be refunded!

twitch.bindRewardsToTimerDesc: Rewards will automatically activate when the timer resumes and deactivate when paused or completed.
twitch.commonRewardsNameDesc: When integration is enabled, rewards in the format "Name + Cost" are automatically created on the channel.

  • {{messageLabel}} - for auctions where the viewer specifies an arbitrary outcome
  • {{usernameLabel}} - convenient in an auction on the victory of a specific person

stopwatch.additionalTimeDesc: Time by which the timer will change when pressing +/-.
stopwatch.minTimeRequired: Do not add time if the timer has more than
stopwatch.startTimeDesc: Time to which the timer returns when reset.
stopwatch.totalTimeHint: Time is only counted when the timer is running. The total time does not grow while the timer is paused.
stopwatch.notOnCondition: DO NOT Add time on conditions
stopwatch.maxAdditionalTimeHint:
Example when the field value is 5 min and leader change happens:
  • Time left 10 min - add extra time
  • Time left 2 min - do not add

rules: Simple text file (extension does not matter)
Positions are separated by a new line
You can specify the cost through a comma - "Name,123"

csv.description: Simple text format where each line represents one lot. The lot name and cost are separated by a pipe symbol (|). If no cost is specified, it defaults to 1.
csv.example:
Game A|150
Game B|75
Game C|200
Game D
